As of Monday, 19 California counties — including Contra Costa, Santa Clara and Solano — are on a state watch list due to signs that coronavirus is spreading, potentially threatening to overload local hospitals.

text:
While options for gatherings are limited in 2020, there are still plenty of possibilities to enjoy the July 4th weekend. We've compiled a list of ways to celebrate in the Bay Area — at a safe social distance or from home.

name: sfchronicle
text: Gov. Newsom signed a $202.1 billion state budget Monday that largely avoids widespread cuts to public services to close a multibillion-dollar deficit caused by the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/c1fVq31s7U

name: sfchronicle
text: A state appeals court upheld voter-approved toll increases for seven Bay Area bridges Monday, saying they were not tax increases requiring two-thirds approval and were legally passed by 55% of the voters in 2018. https://t.co/gSpASaCkfQ
